info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 3:37PM CDT until April 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... .A cold front Wednesday brings moderate northerly winds across Deep South Texas Wednesday afternoon, with relative humidity values dropping into the teens along and west of I69C/US281 and below 30 degrees along and east of I69E/US77 with exception to the immediate coastline. Near record heat is expected across most of the Rio Grande Valley, with triple digit high temperatures possible into early afternoon. Worsening drought conditions, critically dry fuels, near record warmth, and an active wildfire season could help drive confidence into a brief Red Flag Warning Wednesday afternoon. Burning of any kind should be avoided. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR FOR WINDS, DRY FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 3 PM to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, and Northern Hidalgo Counties. * TIMING...3 PM to 8 PM. * WIND...Northerly 15 to 20 mph, gusts as high as 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent across inland counties and 20 to 35 percent along inland coastal counties. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
